title: Import data into R, with an application to the National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS)
text: , 3 related packages: surveytable: functions tabulating survey estimates nchsdata: public use files (PUFs) National Center Health Statistics (NCHS) importsurvey: functions importing data R importsurvey imports surveys R currently formats. Public versions surveys already imported stored nchsdata. Tables estimates can generated using surveytable.

what: Import SAS data into R — import_sas
title: Import SAS data into R — import_sas
text: Import SAS data R

title: Import SAS data into R — import_sas
code: import_sas(   sas_data,   sas_formats_data,   formats,   bool_levels = c("yes", "no"),   bool_true = "yes",   bool_false = "no",   formats_func = NULL )

title: Import SAS data into R — import_sas
text: sas_data SAS survey data file sas_formats_data SAS formats data file (produced CNTLOUT option PROC FORMAT) formats formats specified? bool_levels variables levels converted factor (categorical) logical bool_true level(s) variables set TRUE bool_false level(s) variables set FALSE formats_func needed formats = "funcname" argument formats determines formats specified: "attr": attr(*, "format.sas") "name": variable name "funcname": formats_func("x") function returns format name variable "x" Levels bool_levels neither bool_true bool_false set NA.

title: Import SAS data into R — import_sas
text: data.frame. complex survey, use svydesign create survey design object.

title: Import SAS data into R — import_sas

text: sas_data SAS survey data file sas_formats_data SAS formats data file (produced PROC FORMAT CNTLOUT option) r_out name new R data file label name survey

text: (Nothing.)

title: Import SAS data into R, with survey design variables the same as those in NAMCS 2019 PUF. — import_sas_namcs2019puf
code: if (FALSE) { import_sas_namcs2019puf(sas_data = "namcs2019_sas.sas7bdat" , sas_formats_data = "namcs_formats_dataset.sas7bdat" , r_out = "namcs_2019_puf.rds" , label = "NAMCS 2019 PUF")  import_sas_namcs2019puf(sas_data = "ed2020_sas.sas7bdat" , sas_formats_data = "ed_formats_dataset.sas7bdat" , r_out = "ed_2020_puf.rds" , label = "ED 2020 PUF") }
